revised_title: Edmund Halley's Defense of Newton's Chronology
tldr: Edmund Halley defends Sir Isaac Newton's chronology against the criticisms of Father Souciet, arguing that the differences in their calculations are due to differing interpretations of Hipparchus' writings on the position of the equinoctial colure. Halley provides his own calculations to support Newton's timeline for the Argonautic Expedition and the fall of Troy.
